content:
Playing around with displaying images in README files: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/popular_tags

backdrop-contrib/popular_tags
Displays popular taxonomy terms under term reference fields. - backdrop-contrib/popular_tags
Don't think Backdrop has an agreed policy on where/how to store images just for this purpose, so I made up my own: a hidden .assets directory.

This is worth discussing -- it would be good to get a recommendation out there. Also I wonder if the script that pulls the README could convert relative URLs to absolute URLs for backdropcms.org. (e.g.https://backdropcms.org/project/popular_tags )
I've seen a few different methods so it would be good to standardize.

Not an answer but related https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/pull/488. Waiting for a couple years now.

Issue #487: Support more data in .info files by docwilmot 路 Pull Request #488 路 backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Fixes #487 Includes fix for API example.

I'm also interested. Currently it's not easy to provide proper screenshots. If putting it in the module/theme, it unnecessarily bloats the package. The Github Wiki could be a solution, but I usually don't enable it. I wonder what the best way is.

I believe that our packaging script has the ability to exclude files. The issue with putting images in the repo is that git clone takes longer on slower connections ...I guess that this might be less and less of an issue in our times, but we should always keep in mind people living in less privileged parts of this world.
